lines: Good evening. Sebastian. Charmed, I'm sure.
Valentin has impeccable taste in both literature and pastries.
His erdbeerstrudel is legendary. I've been looking forward to this.
introduction.notebookNote: Sebastian is refined and cultured. Appreciates Valentin's taste in food and books.

lines: This is quite the predicament. Most unseemly.
I was perusing Valentin's first editions during the... incident.
I assure you, I saw nothing out of the ordinary.
followUpLines: I find this entire situation distasteful.
Surely we can resolve this like civilized people?

lines: If you must know, I did notice the plate at one point.
It was oddly pristine, as if someone had cleaned it deliberately.
followUpLines: The sooner this is over, the better.
postIncident.notebookNote: Sebastian noticed the plate was unusually clean. Why mention this specifically?

lines: I suppose I should contribute more information.
I saw Emma lingering near the dessert area. She seemed quite... interested in the strudel.
followUpLines: Take that information as you will.
I'm merely reporting what I observed.
Everyone here has been acting suspiciously, if you ask me.
postIncident.notebookNote: Sebastian claims Emma was very interested in the strudel. Everyone's pointing fingers...

lines: I see you've been exceptionally thorough.
I did sample the strudel. More than a sample, actually. But I left some! I'm certain of it.
followUpLines: It was simply too tempting to resist.
But I'm not solely responsible for its disappearance.
Several people took pieces. This is a collective guilt, not individual.
postIncident.notebookNote: Sebastian admits to eating 'more than a sample' but insists others did too. Shared guilt?
